result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

Defn is eligible for SPD but no appointment has been made as of yet

1:45 PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Keith K Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Rebekah Renneke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant still waiting for an attorney to be appointed. Defendant waives time limits.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report:  Defn is eligible for SPD services and waiting for Atty to be appointed

Defendant Keith K Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn previously applied for SPD and qualified; SPD has not appointed counsel. Colloquy w/ defn RE: time limits for a preliminary hearing. Statement by defn; defn wishes to have a lawyer present. CT makes findings and finds good cause to set over. Bail cont.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alex E, Glenn M, or Alexandra T.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

1:51 PM Defendant Keith K Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Keith K Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
